text:
Personal experience: 7 mistakes of a novice entrepreneur
07 Nov 2019, 18:00 by Anna Ermakova
Neglect of advertising, too little financial cushion and excessive modesty can make your path to success difficult.



Anna Ermakova Brand Developer, Creative Director of Brand to GO Studio.
In September 2019, two years of my entrepreneurial activity were celebrated. I came to the exit from the corporate world consciously, having studied other people's mistakes, but this did not help me get around the well-known rake. Maybe my experience will allow others not to step on them?
1. The first business in a new field
I, a marketing marketer by training, have worked in marketing, branding and project management since 2006, but for some reason I decided to start my own business in tourism. Romantic, but not rational. The idea captured the mind so much that the logic shut down. As a result, I spent the most expensive - time - on sorting out a new topic, but estimated the scale of the disaster and still switched to a sphere that I understand better. With a fellow designer, we launched a design studio. And I decided to return to the topic of tourism later, when in the first, more understandable case, I get used to the business world.
If you are already a good and well-known specialist on the market, maybe you should not cross out all your experience and acquired contacts? Try ‚Äúlooking for yourself near the place where you lost,‚Äù as Elena Rezanova writes in her book, ‚ÄúNever. How to break the deadlock and find yourself. " Start doing what you are already doing, but in a different format.
2. Lack of financial pillow
Realizing that it takes time to start a business, I gave myself two months: for exactly this period I had a supply of money. When it was exhausted, and orders had not yet arrived, I had to run my hand in a credit card, and this became a difficult decision. I sold everything unnecessary, switched to a monotonous diet, I did not get enough sleep from tension and uncertainty in the usual 7-8 hours, and once a week I found gray hair.
Going into your business is an effective way to lose weight in a short time, but not very healthy. It took me a total of six months to set up the system and get a plus. My ideas for capturing the world had to be divided into three and prepare an appropriate financial reserve. Later I learned to be realistic in planning both income and expenses.
An entrepreneur or a self-employed who does not have a stable income is simply obliged to plan future expenses and see where he will get the resources for them, and also to know his living wage.
A financial pillow in the amount of a personal living wage should be enough for at least six months, or better for a year. The more voluminous it is, the more time we ‚Äúbuy‚Äù for experiments - also an idea from the aforementioned book. On the other hand, the smaller the pillow, the faster life will make you spin. Some may sit on stocks for a year and only get closer to their end.
3. The opinion that a good project does not need advertising
The first six months would not be so hungry if we, specialists known to a narrow circle, expanded our audience with the minimum investment in advertising. For the context or target in our market, fabulous amounts were not required: it was a question of 3-10 thousand rubles. You can independently deal with the settings or agree on barter.
The conviction that we are so cool that we do not need advertising has stolen several months. After 12 years in high-paying marketing positions, it‚Äôs hard to take off the crown and admit that now you have to re-prove what you are standing in the market for. Free sources of promotion paid off, but investing in ads would pay off faster.
Lost time and lost profits are the result of neglecting timely investments in online advertising.
Starting a new business, lay a budget for promotion. Great if you do not need it. If you didn‚Äôt enter the business with an active client base, then the first time will have to be spent on introducing the market to your company. This requires investment - for small businesses they are quite uplifting.
4. Underestimation of the power of networking
Not so terrible is the lack of advertising, as the neglect of the possibilities of free promotion. Uncertainty in yourself and your product, ‚Äúimpostor syndrome‚Äù, is what prevented you from immediately declaring yourself.
At first, only close friends were aware of our work in the new field. The first customers were just acquaintances, they gave recommendations that were converted into applications. I decided to make social networks open and talk about the studio there only after a couple of months.
Observation of other novice entrepreneurs helped to overcome modesty. A couple of times I attended special networking meetings where I met dozens of people who ‚Äútested a niche‚Äù. That is, they tried themselves in a matter in which they still do not understand, but sold their services expensively, as already established professionals.
The usefulness of such events for expanding the customer base and the circle of partners is very doubtful, but you should not completely neglect the opportunities to make new friends.
We did something to the two start-ups from that meeting at a price lower than the cost, they appreciated the help and later recommended us to familiar businessmen with whom it turned out to be a more profitable cooperation. And then word of mouth started. For two years, we have never resorted to paid promotion, most clients come by recommendations.
Start talking about your new business not only to friends, but to the market as early as possible. Attend events attended by your future customers, not ‚Äúcolleagues in misfortune.‚Äù Build a personal brand and broadcast it on social networks long before going free.
5. Perfectionism
Not only in IT, it makes sense to release a minimally viable product in order to have feedback, test hypotheses and receive first incomes. To launch a design studio, it was enough to collect a portfolio for landing and social networks. However, all of our perfectionism went into the development of our own visual identity and website.
Indeed, we are going to offer our branding services, how can we ourselves not look at the top five? And in front of colleagues in the shop it‚Äôs awkward, far from ideal. Objectively, even the first draft of our site looked better than most players of our sizes in the segment - it did not interfere with attracting orders.
It was worth spending two months not to finish the visual part, but to build communication with the target audience.
It‚Äôs better to enter the market sooner with a product or service unfinished to perfection, but test your offer on real customers and start receiving feedback and profit, than to postpone the launch, having hit into perfectionism.
6. Inconsistency
If we are too stuck on the packaging of a business, then others often, on the contrary, forget about it and wonder: why is it not going? Carrying for months a project logo that may not shoot is just as wrong as not believing that one is greeted with clothes and hammering on aesthetics.
Many people think that at the start you need to invest heavily, immediately register as an individual entrepreneur and rent an office. I legally became an individual entrepreneur only when the first client appeared who worked strictly by bank transfer. We ordered business cards for the first meeting. And we never needed an office: customers prefer to meet on their territory so as not to waste time on travel. After a year, we went online completely and now we work remotely from different parts of the world.
Step by step: first packaging ‚Äúon the knee‚Äù, test advertising, checking the viability of a business idea, and after the first sales - investments in branding, office, equipment, promotion.
7. Artificial motivation
The first question to ask is: ‚ÄúWhy do I have to do my job?‚Äù If you want to get more money, maybe it‚Äôs easier to change your employer? If you are tired of going to the office, then agree with your boss about a flexible schedule? I lacked freedom and independence: I wanted to choose which of my clients and colleagues to work with and who to not, to find mobility, to be at the helm of a small mechanism, and not the executive screw of a corporate machine.
The second question: ‚ÄúWhy do I need money or free time?‚Äù
At first, I tried to impose on myself the ‚Äúright‚Äù goals: early repay the mortgage, for example. But this aspiration did not become a dream, he did not have enough energy to inspire, to lift in the morning and to help overcome difficulties.
I was ready to deny myself paid entertainment and new clothes, if the set financial goals failed. The most difficult thing was the lack of travel - that‚Äôs where my motivation was buried. I had to trick: in order not to postpone trips until the time when I earn money for them, I first bought a ticket, and with it I made sense to work. The upcoming adventure invigorated me and made me move, and what kind of attitude, such and the result.
I spent these two years in 13 countries and as many regions of Russia. Remote work and constant movement have become a way of life, which is now not easy to refuse.
If, when working in a company, the corporate system itself with a boss and KPI serves as an incentive to complete tasks, then it‚Äôs easy to relax in free swimming. The strongest business plan may collapse due to lack of motivation for its executor. Mandatory payments (rental housing, loans, utility bills, purchase of products) do not work as a positive reinforcement. You need to have clear incendiary goals, each of them has their own. Encouraging yourself for achievements, celebrating small victories is also an important part of motivation.
